content.text:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the table, the book in the refrigerator and the mop in the wardrobe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
> open cupboard

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the table, the book in the refrigerator and the mop in the wardrobe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
> open cupboard
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> go to hallway

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the table, the book in the refrigerator and the mop in the wardrobe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
> open cupboard
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> go to hallway
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a broom closet, a kitchen and a living room here.
> take potted plant

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the table, the book in the refrigerator and the mop in the wardrobe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
> open cupboard
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> go to hallway
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a broom closet, a kitchen and a living room here.
> take potted plant
You take the potted plant. In your inventory you have a potted plant.
> go to living room

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the table, the book in the refrigerator and the mop in the wardrobe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
> open cupboard
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> go to hallway
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a broom closet, a kitchen and a living room here.
> take potted plant
You take the potted plant. In your inventory you have a potted plant.
> go to living room
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a shelf. There are passages to a hallway and a bedroom here.
> put potted plant on side table

clem_player.response: > put potted plant on side table
